name: riskActivity
description: The following is a fictional "choose your own adventure" type story designed to help model real-life risk tolerance based on risk tolerance in games. The content of the following story, based off of Rob Cantor's "Shia LaBeouf" production, contains fictional gore/violence.
While the activity is meant to be entertaining, please answer all questions honestly and rationally.
disclaimer: Before continuing, please acknowledge that you have read these details and consent to proceed with the activity.
citations: Content modified from: Cantor, R. (2014, Oct 21). "Shia LaBeouf" Live - Rob Cantor. Retrieved from https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o0u4M6vppCI
Images from: Ramos, K. (2012, Nov 16). Actual Cannibal Shia Labeouf (Song: Rob Cantor). Retrieved from https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3Nfg-WC7YY0

preText: You're walking in the woods
There's no one around and your phone is dead
Out of the corner of your eye, you spot something
It’s dark out, it’s probably nothing
Do you check it out?

action: You see a pair of eyes… a figure… Can it be? (Shia LaBeouf)
He's following you, about thirty feet back
You keep on your way and think happy thoughts
Then you hear it, a twig snap about thirty feet back (Shia LaBeouf)

postText: Maybe he just needs directions

preText: You can hasten your pace
Or turn around and confront him

action: Your pace is brisk but so is his
He gets down on all fours and breaks into a sprint
"Famed actor Shia LaBeouf?" you cry out
Without words, he gets down on all fours and breaks into a sprint

postText: He's gaining on you
You know your car is nearby, but maybe you can lose him in the woods
Where do you run to?

action: You're looking for your car, but you're all turned around
You sprint into the woods, weaving between trees

postText: He's almost upon you now, and you can see there's blood on his face
My God, there's blood everywhere!

responses.response: Slowly walk away (maybe you’ll lose him)
Sprint away as fast as you can

preText: Now it's dark, and you seem to have lost him
But you're hopelessly lost yourself
Stranded with a murderer (Shia LaBeouf)
Do you try and remain quiet
Or make a break for it?

action: You creep silently through the underbrush
You head towards the edge of the woods as fast as you can

postText: Aha! In the distance
A small cottage with a light on
Hope!
You move <MOVEMENT_SPEED> toward it
But your leg! AH! It's caught in a bear trap!
You pry the trap from the ground
But the teeth have an iron bite

preText: Leaving it would slow you down, but maybe you’ll keep your leg
Do you drag it along or cut off you own leg?

action: Hobbling in pain, quiet, quiet

variables.LEG_DRAG_CUT: hears the clank of the bear trap
variables.LEG_DRAG_CUT_AFTER: Leg still caught in a bear trap

action: Gnawing off your leg, quiet, quiet

variables.LEG_DRAG_CUT_AFTER: Blood oozing from your stump leg

postText: Limping toward the cottage, quiet, quiet
Now you're on the doorstep
Sitting inside, Shia LaBeouf
Sharpening an axe, Shia LaBeouf

preText: You could catch him by surprise
Or try and hide outside

action: He doesn't hear you enter, Shia LaBeouf
You're sneaking up behind him…
Strangling superstar Shia LaBeouf
He <LEG_DRAG_CUT>, Shia LaBeouf
He finds you and drags you from underneath the porch..
Being strangled by superstar Shia LaBeouf

postText: Fighting for your life with Shia LaBeouf
Wrestling a knife from Shia LaBeouf

preText: The knife is a meter away, but there’s an old bottle closer
You need a weapon, which do you grab?

action: You just barely get the knife
Stab it in his kidney
You brandish your bottle
Smash it on his head

postText: He keels over
Safe at last from Shia LaBeouf
You limp into the dark woods
<LEG_DRAG_CUT_AFTER>
You've beaten Shia LaBeouf…

preText: Wait! He isn't dead! Shia surprise!
There's a gun to your head and death in his eyes
But maybe underneath he has a kind soul
Will you plea for mercy
Or stand your ground and fight?

action: You remember you can do Jiu Jitsu (You can do it)
Body slam superstar Shia LaBeouf
Your words are touching
He throws down the gun and raises his fists

postText: Legendary fight with Shia LaBeouf
Normal Tuesday night for Shia Labeouf
He hits you in the jaw, you fall to the ground
And blood is draining fast from your <LEG_CUT_STUMP> leg
Under some leaves, an axe

preText: Your cousin once taught you to throw tomahawks
Or you can get up and swing at him

action: You try to swing an axe at Shia LaBeouf
He's dodging every swipe, he parries to the left
You counter to the right, you catch him in the neck
You try to throw an axe at Shia LaBeouf
Your aim of off, he throws you instead
You land next to the axe and take another shot
You catch him in the neck

postText: You're chopping off his head now...
You have just decapitated Shia LaBeouf!
His head topples to the floor, expressionless
You fall to your knees and catch your breath
You're finally safe from Shia LaBeouf...

name: financialRisk
description: The following survey is used to gauge your financial risk tolerance, and is designed to help us model and predict risk tolerance.
Please choose the response that best describes you. There are no "right" or "wrong" answers.
citations: Risk Tolerance Quiz Source: Grable, J. E., & Lytton, R. H. (1999). Financial risk tolerance revisited: The development of a risk assessment instrument. Financial Services Review, 8, 163-181.

questions.question: In general, how would your best friend describe you as a risk taker?

responses.response: Willing to take risks after completing adequate research

questions.question: You are on a TV game show and can choose one of the following. Which would you take?
You have just finished saving for a "once-in-a-lifetime" vacation. Three weeks before you plan to leave, you lose your job. You would:

responses.response: Take a much more modest vacation
Go as scheduled, reasoning that you need the time to prepare for a job search
Extend your vacation, because this might be your last chance to go first-class

questions.question: If you unexpectedly received $20,000 to invest, what would you do?

responses.response: Deposit it in a bank account, money market account, or an insured CD
Invest it in safe high quality bonds or bond mutual funds
Invest it in stocks or stock mutual funds

questions.question: In terms of experience, how comfortable are you investing in stocks or stock mutual funds?
When you think of the word "risk" which of the following words comes to mind first?

Some experts are predicting the price of real estate in your area to rise; bond prices may fall, however, experts tend to agree that government bonds are relatively safe. Most of your investment assets are now in high-interest government bonds. What would you do?

responses.response: Sell the bonds, put half the proceeds into money market accounts, and the other half into real estate
Sell the bonds and put the total proceeds into real estate
Sell the bonds put all the money into real estate, and borrow additional money to buy more

questions.question: Given the best- and worst-case returns of the four investment choices below, which would you prefer?

responses.response: $200 gain best case; $0 gain/loss worst case
$800 gain best case; $200 loss worst case
$2,600 gain best case; $800 loss worst case
$4,800 gain best case; $2,400 loss worst case

questions.question: In addition to whatever you own, you have been given $1,000. You are now asked to choose between:

responses.response: A 50% chance to gain $1,000 and a 50% chance to gain nothing

questions.question: In addition to whatever you own, you have been given $2,000. You are now asked to choose between:

responses.response: A 50% chance to lose $1,000 and a 50% chance to lose nothing

questions.question: Suppose a relative left you an inheritance of $100,000, stipulating in the will that you invest ALL the money in ONE of the following choices. Which one would you select?

responses.response: A savings account or money market mutual fund
A mutual fund that owns stocks and bonds

questions.question: If you had to invest $20,000, which of the following investment choices would you find most appealing?

responses.response: 60% in low-risk investments 30% in medium-risk investments 10% in high-risk investments
30% in low-risk investments 40% in medium-risk investments 30% in high-risk investments
10% in low-risk investments 40% in medium-risk investments 50% in high-risk investments

questions.question: Your trusted friend and neighbor, an experienced geologist, is putting together a group of investors to fund an exploratory gold mining venture. The venture could pay back 50 to 100 times the investment if successful. If the mine is a bust, the entire investment is worthless. Your friend estimates the chance of success is only 20%. If you had the money, how much would you invest?
What is your current age in years?

responses.response: Not married but living with significant other

questions.question: What is the highest level of education you have completed?
What is your household's approximate annual gross income before taxes?
